subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Test coverage - Statement complete
msgSnippet: Does it intergrate well with Oracle application server (iAS) or any other application server? Thanks! ... __________________________________________________ Do
messageBody:
Does it intergrate well with Oracle application server
(iAS) or any other application server? Thanks!

--- Scott Vachalek <svachalek@...> wrote:
> Hello,
>
> I am not unbiased but we have a pretty good tool at:
>
> http://testersedge.com/gjtk/
>
> It is free only for non-commercial use, but most
> users
> are pleased with performance and ease of use. It
> will
> even attribute the coverage to specific JUnit tests.
>
> Scott
>
>
>
> --- shmaytan <shmaytan@...> wrote:
> > Hi!
> >
> > I have a bunch of white-box Junit tests and I
> would
> > like to check if I
> > have executed every line of code with the tests.
> > Not just every
> > method, but every line of code within the method.
> >
> > Does anyone know of a good tool (hopefully
> free...)
> > that works on Linux???
> >
> > Thanks,
> > -Eytan
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
